intro: Hesperis revoluta, commonly known as the Scotch Heather, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Hesperis revoluta is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny habitats.
